snippet: Hundreds of United States hospitals will pay a total of more than $250 million stemming from claims that they implanted cardiac devices in Medicare patients in violation of coverage requirements.
abstract: Justice Department says hundreds of United States hospitals will pay total of over $250 million resulting from claims they implanted cardiac devices in Medicare patients in violation of coverage requirements.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of United States hospitals will pay a total of more than $250 million stemming from claims that they implanted cardiac devices in Medicare patients in violation of coverage requirements.

headline.print_headline: Hospitals Fined $250 Million Over Cardiac Devices
headline.main: Hospitals Fined $250 Million Over Cardiac Devices
